michelle.goal: Participate in scheduling a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits my existing calendar.

steven.goal: Participate in scheduling a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits my existing calendar.

jerry.goal: Participate in scheduling a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits my existing calendar.

orchestrator.goal: Orchestrate inputs from participants and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that schedules a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 respecting all participants' busy slots.

public_information: Schedule a one-hour meeting for Michelle, Steven and Jerry on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
All participants' existing busy slots must be respected.
There exists at least one feasible solution fitting everyone's schedule.

share_schedule.system_prompt: You are Michelle. Provide your busy time intervals for Monday in a concise machine-readable list of intervals in HH:MM-HH:MM format relative to the work day. Do not produce PDDL.
share_schedule.prompt: Agent michelle. Public information: Schedule a one-hour meeting for Michelle, Steven and Jerry on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Your private information: Busy Monday 11:00-12:00. Your goal: Participate in scheduling a one-hour meeting that fits your calendar. Provide your busy intervals as a machine-readable list.

share_schedule.system_prompt: You are Steven. Provide your busy time intervals for Monday in a concise machine-readable list of intervals in HH:MM-HH:MM format relative to the work day. Do not produce PDDL.
share_schedule.prompt: Agent steven. Public information: Schedule a one-hour meeting for Michelle, Steven and Jerry on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Your private information: Busy Monday 09:00-09:30, 11:30-12:00, 13:30-14:00, 15:30-16:00. Your goal: Participate in scheduling a one-hour meeting that fits your calendar. Provide your busy intervals as a machine-readable list.

share_schedule.system_prompt: You are Jerry. Provide your busy time intervals for Monday in a concise machine-readable list of intervals in HH:MM-HH:MM format relative to the work day. Do not produce PDDL.
share_schedule.prompt: Agent jerry. Public information: Schedule a one-hour meeting for Michelle, Steven and Jerry on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00. Your private information: Busy Monday 09:00-09:30, 10:00-11:00, 11:30-12:30, 13:00-14:30, 15:30-16:00, 16:30-17:00. Your goal: Participate in scheduling a one-hour meeting that fits your calendar. Provide your busy intervals as a machine-readable list.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the participants' machine-readable busy intervals to construct a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes scheduling a one-hour meeting between 09:00 and 17:00 on Monday respecting all busy slots. Target the FastDownwards solver compatibility. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and agent-related constraints explicit and distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Inputs are participants' schedules given as lists of busy intervals. Use the public information: meeting day Monday, work hours 09:00-17:00, meeting duration 60 minutes, and the participants' private schedules. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Provide a clear model that allows finding a one-hour slot that fits everyone.
